title: Quinta do Filoco 2011 Reserva Red (Douro)
description: Strong tannins dominate this wine. It comes from a good vintage, but it is quite extracted. It could soften, although it may remain a tough wine.

title: Quinta dos Poços 2014 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)
description: The tannins dominate this wine, giving a hard-edged character. It is firm but without the fruit weight to support it.

title: South Stage 2010 Alchemy Red (Rogue Valley)
description: This six-year-old wine is 40% Tempranillo, 40% Carmenère and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon. The Carmenère dominates, pushing stiff, tannic, stemmy flavors into the core. It's not in danger of aging too quickly, but the tannins seem unlikely to soften.

title: Villa Giada 2015 Suri  (Moscato d'Asti)
description: This frothy wine offers aromas of cut grass, hay and chopped herb. The aromas carry over to the sweet simple palate along with ripe apricot and a confectionery note.

title: Viñalba 2014 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Valle de Uco)
description: Damp earthy berry aromas are a touch murky. This feels bulky, grabby and tannic, while overriding flavors of coffee, toast and bitter chocolate make fruit a bit player. A choppy finish with hard tannins and herbal berry flavors puts this Cabernet in the midtier category.

title: Sanguinhal 2013 Casabel Red (Lisboa)
description: This soft, wine is full of ripe black-currant flavors. It is smooth and rounded, with a touch of wood and plenty of acidity. Drink now.

title: Chic Barcelona NV Semi-Sec Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: Perfumed aromas are forced and less than natural. This feels about right, with citric acidity maintaining balance. Flavors of candied orange and cantaloupe finish with obvious residual sugar along with modest acidic cut.

title: Covila 2015 Adivino Tinto Joven  (Rioja)
description: Fiery cherry cough-drop aromas are basic at best, crude at worst. Bright and wiry in feel, this tastes of medicinal red fruits.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Paxis Pinot Noir (Lisboa)
description: This softly perfumed wine has red-fruit flavors and plenty of acidity. It is jammy and juicy with succulent red berries. Drink now.

title: Casa Ferreirinha 2015 Esteva Red (Douro)
description: This wine is ripe, fruity and balanced. It has red-berry flavors along with acidity and a bright aftertaste. Drink from 2019

title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Gewurztraminer (Lisboa)
description: This is a typically perfumed Gewürztraminer with the twist of a cool ocean climate. That coolness allows plenty of acidity to come into this dry, fruity wine and adds a floral character. With its crispness, it is bright as well as aromatic. Drink now.

title: Château de Birot 2015  Bordeaux Blanc
description: The Birot estate is in Cadillac, the fortress town on the banks of the Garonne. This classic Sauvignon and Sémillon blend is herbal, green and grassy. It is bright with acidity and lemon fruit and with a lightly tangy texture. Drink now.

title: Adega Mãe 2014 Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: With light wood-aging flavors, this creamy wine is still young, with tangy orange and lemon zest as well as touches of vanilla. Let it develop further and drink from late 2017.

title: Adega Mãe 2014 Viognier (Lisboa)
description: This is a wood-fermented wine, spicy and lightly perfumed. The wood aging does dominate the yellow fruits and acidity that still need time. Drink this wine from late 2017.

title: Barba 2013 I Vasari Old Vines  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)
description: Aromas of French oak and coconut lead the nose. Oak carries over to the lean, bracing palate where you'll also detect raw sour cherry. It lacks the fruit richness needed to stand up to the oak while raspy tannins leave an astringent, mouth puckering finish.

title: Beacon Hill 2015 Riesling (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This is dry, almost sour, despite its low alcohol, and feels disjointed. Along with the sour citrus flavor is a conflicting streak of too-ripe fruit. Interesting components, but they may or may not knit together with more bottle age.

title: Luca Faccinelli 2013 Matteo Bandello Rosso  (Valtellina)
description: Brisk and simple, this vibrant red has aromas and flavors of tart red berry, rose and an herbaceous note. It's on the lean side, with bracing acidity and fleeting tannins that give it an abrupt finish.

title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Pouca Roupa Rosé (Alentejano)
description: While this wine's moniker literally translates as “scantily dressed,” it is derived from the name of the vineyard. The wine is light and crisply fruity, with red-currant fruit and plenty of acidity. It is ready to drink.

title: Quinta da Padrela 2014 Red (Douro)
description: This wine is firm and closed up, with signs of heavy-handed extraction that give it a seriously dry character. It is hard to see these going away.

title: Quinta dos Avidagos 2015 Reserva Red (Douro)
description: This is a very young wine, still dominated by its wood aging. It is spicy, with layers of red-berry fruits under the strong wood flavors. Let this wine develop over the medium term and drink from 2020.

title: Vicente Faria Vinhos 2014 Animus Red (Douro)
description: This wine is ripe, full of easy fruits and likely to develop quickly. It has a juicy character, attractive berry flavors and gentle tannins. Drink from 2019.

title: Vicente Gandia NV El Miracle Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: This Garnacha-based Cava smells a bit rustic, baked and savory, though not outright weird. A collapsed palate displays mild citric acidity, while basic nectarine and citrus flavors take on a bitter note that carries onto a simple finish.

title: The Lane NV Lois Blanc de Blancs  (Adelaide Hills)
description: This fruit-driven wine doesn't show the complexity of much lees aging, but satisfies with its clean, refreshing flavors of pineapple, peach and melon. It's light in body and nearly dry.

title: Tossals 2014 Junior Red (Montsant)
description: Grassy raspberry and cherry aromas are a bit leathery. This Carignan-Garnacha-Syrah blend feels saturated but not entirely comfortable. Jammy ripe mixed-berry flavors are chunky, candied and finish hot, with chocolaty oak.

title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2015 Château Tuilerie Pagès  (Entre-Deux-Mers)
description: This is a crisp herbal wine, bright with acidity and marked with lemon and grapefruit tastes. It is light and bright with a mineral edge that gives it a fine texture. Drink now.

title: Codorníu NV Reserva Cuvée Barcelona 1872 Sparkling (Cava)
description: Clover and apple aromas are basic but fresh. This is simple on the palate, with little to the mouthfeel. Vapid flavors of soda crackers, spent yeast and apple cider disappear on a quick finish.

title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Azulado Red (Lisboa)
description: This new wine is produced at Quinta de Pancas in the Lisboa region. It is soft, fruity and created to be drunk young. Bright red fruits and attractive acidity give a crisp wine ready to drink.

title: Carletto 2015  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
description: Here's a rustic zesty red that has aromas of ripe berry, game and whiff of tilled soil. The gamy note carries over to the simple, quaffable palate along with ripe black cherry and a hint of dark spice. Drink soon.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Paseo of Portugal Red (Lisboa)
description: This fruity blend shows spice from oak aging and black-currant flavors. Soft and only lightly textured, it is a wine to drink young to benefit from the fruitiness.

title: Cerulean 2012 Acadia Vineyards Tempranillo (Columbia Gorge (WA))
description: The thin diluted fruit suggests rhubarb and raspberry. There's an abundance of acid, which will help to pair this with creamy sauces. Drink up.
